title: WTB: T207 Recruit class Anon 3 or Napoleon back
author: Seiklis

posts.post_title: WTB: T207 Recruit class Anon 3 or Napoleon back
posts.post_content:
Looking for any Recruit class T207 Cleveland player with an Anon 3 or Napoleon back. 

Any of the following would also apply
Art Wilson (Napoleon)
Ernest Wilie (Napoleon)
Bob Higgins (Anon 3 or Napoleon)

If you have any of the cards for sale please reply, pm or e-mail me at [URL="XxSeiklis_GrockxX@hotmail.com"]XxSeiklis_GrockxX@hotmail.com[/URL]

Thanks

Interesting want list.  Always fun to find more T207 collectors.

Anon 3 Recruit-series backs are quite scarce.  From the information I have, there are only 49 players known.  Easterly and George are the 2 known Cleveland players.  There was a recent Heritage auction lot of 95 different Anon 3 players, with all 49 known Recruit-series cards and 46 of the Broadleaf-series cards, out of 50 known.  

Wilie and Art Wilson are not known with an Anon 3 back.  Higgins is, though.

Ah thanks, I wasn't sure who had Anon 3 backs among the Cleveland players, figures it's none of the easier Recruit class though only 3 of them possibly existing does surprise me

I lucked into a Anon 25 for Broadleaf so hopefully I can luck into an Anon 3

Hi Jack,

I can help you out with at least one of the cards.  Images below (apologies for the size).

Vean Gregg - Anon Factory 3 (Broadleaf class) - SGC 20 $110
Lefty George - Anon Factory 3 - (Recruit class) - raw ($135)

Echoing Ron's comments ... though the Recruit class cards are in general significantly easier to find than the Broadleaf class cards, that not entirely true with the Anon-factory 3 backs.  It's a tough back for the Recruits - easily as difficult as Napoleon, apparently.

Don't have a spare Napoleon, though or I'd be glad to help out.

(oops - re-read that you have BL covered - ignore the Gregg.)
